title: Over 120million hungry rats to 'take over British homes' as weather gets colder
text:

Rats are set to take over UK homes as 120million rodents creep into properties across the country this winter.

The pests are being driven indoors in search of a 'warm and cosy' environment.

Experts have warned that the brown rats are likely to cause chaos in British properties, gnawing through electrical wires and wooden beams.

The animals, which can have up to six litters a year, are expected to set up camp in attics, lofts and stair cupboards.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

Paul Bates, of Cleankill Pest Control, told The Sun : "Recent heavy rain has forced many rats above ground.

"There is lots of food around for rats at the moment, with ripe fruit and crops from harvesting, so the rat population is peaking at the moment.

"As it gets colder, however, as it is now, rats will move closer to food supplies indoors and for somewhere warm to nest - that means people's homes."

He urged to plug any gaps in their homes and clear up any food debris to avoid vermin infestations.

The imminent rat invasion comes after residents in Runcorn, Cheshire, stopped allowing their children to play outside after rats overran a home.

A cleaning team described the property as one of the worst cases they had ever seen, The Sun reports.

During the summer heatwave, a neighbouring couple were unable to leave any windows or doors open, for fear of rats and flies, and had to invest in air conditioning supplies.

Pest control firms typically experience a 30 to 40 per cent increase in infestation call-outs at this time of the year.
description: Millions of rats are expected to creep into cupboards, attics and lofts across the UK
